bill_title: to revise certain speed limits on township roads.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish fifty-five miles per hour as the speed limit on township roads. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Unless otherwise provided pursuant to § 32-25-9.1, no person may drive a vehicle on a township road in excess of fifty-five miles per hour. Driving in excess of the speed limit established in this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. The township shall post the speed limit on any township road for which a speed limit that is greater or less than fifty-five miles per hour has been established pursuant to § 32-25-9.1. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make the speed limits on township and county roads consistent. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-25-9.1 be amended to read as follows: 32-25-9.1. Any board of county commissioners may determine and establish speed zones or reduced speed limits upon all or any part of the highways under its jurisdiction and upon streets and highways on the request of and after any other local authority having charge of the maintenance thereof has declared its intention to post speed zones. Such speed zones Unless otherwise provided pursuant to this section, the speed limit on any township road is the same as the maximum speed limit on the county roads in the county in which the township is located. Any speed zone or reduced speed limit established pursuant to this section shall be conspicuously posted at the beginning and ending of the zones speed zone or speed limit area by the entity having jurisdiction over the affected portion of road or highway . BILL HISTORY 1/24/97 First read in House and referred to Transportation. H.J. 114 1/29/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/97 Transportation Do Pass, AYES 8, NAYS 3. H.J. 210 2/6/97 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, AYES 61, NAYS 7. H.J. 342 2/6/97 Amended title. H.J. 343

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain speed limits on township roads. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Unless otherwise provided pursuant to § 32-25-9.1, the speed limit on any township road is the same as the speed limit on the county roads in the county in which the township is located up to a maximum of fifty-five miles per hour. Driving in excess of the speed limit established in this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. BILL HISTORY 1/24/97 First read in House and referred to Transportation. H.J. 114 1/29/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/97 Transportation Do Pass, AYES 8, NAYS 3. H.J. 210 2/5/97 Motion to Amend. H.J. 322 2/5/97 Motion to Amend. H.J. 322 2/6/97 Motion to Amend. H.J. 342 2/6/97 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, AYES 61, NAYS 7. H.J. 342 2/6/97 House of Representatives Title Amended. H.J. 343 2/7/97 First read in Senate and referred to Transportation. S.J. 361 2/13/97 Transportation Do Pass Amended, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 420 2/13/97 Transportation Title Amended. 2/13/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain speed limits on township roads. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Unless otherwise provided pursuant to § 32-25-9.1, the speed limit on any township road is the same as the speed limit on the county roads in the county in which the township is located up to a maximum of fifty-five miles per hour. If the county has retained sixty-five miles per hour as the speed limit for all county roads, the speed limit on township roads in the county is sixty-five miles per hour unless otherwise provided pursuant to § 32-25- 9.1. Driving in excess of the speed limit established in this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. BILL HISTORY 1/24/97 First read in House and referred to Transportation. H.J. 114 1/29/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/29/97 Transportation Do Pass, Passed, AYES 8, NAYS 3. H.J. 210 2/5/97 Motion to Amend,. H.J. 322 2/5/97 Motion to Amend,. H.J. 342 2/6/97 House of Representatives Title Amended. H.J. 343 2/7/97 First read in Senate and referred to Transportation. S.J. 361 2/13/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/13/97 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 420 2/15/97 Senate Deferred to another day.
